resource.chars:
Pedal-focused performance: the musical performance is focused on transforming a pre-recorded sound-source using effect pedals. This gesture is a reversal of the traditional use of effect pedals: they are not supposed to be the center of the performance. Rather, they usually embellish the sound of a guitar or a synth. The musical gestures then focus on the guitar/synth, and the pedals are left relatively untouched. Effect pedals are amongst the most "traditional" noise instruments, often stacked one after another, connected to a contact microphone or set up in a "no-input" loop (where the output of a mixer is run through pedals  which are plugged in the same mixer, causing feedback that is modulated by the pedals).

 

See the previous picture for a detailed study of the gear used by The Rita and the way it is connected.

item.value: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><path xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" d="M1308.12137,1965.87335h-535.10554v0h-535.10554v336.87335v336.87335h535.10554h535.10554v-336.87335z" data-paper-data="{"strokeWidth":1,"rotation":0,"annotation":null,"nonHoverStrokeColor":["Color",0,0.74902,1],"editable":true}" id="rectangle_6f51c22c-a09c-4ea3-98e5-5c38a32adb55" fill-opacity="0.00001" fill="#00bfff" fill-rule="nonzero" stroke="#00bfff" stroke-width="25.83641" stroke-linecap="butt" stroke-linejoin="miter" stroke-miterlimit="10" stroke-dasharray="" stroke-dashoffset="0" font-family="none" font-weight="none" font-size="none" text-anchor="none" style="mix-blend-mode: normal"/></svg>

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Discipline as a value : obviously, a musician's gestures and their behaviour are significant. As a performer, The Rita notoriously shows restraint, keeping a straight face, not interacting with the public and being focused on the sound (as seen <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gHFwn68Pc0Y" target="_blank" rel="noopener">here). This is typical of part of the American/Canadian noise scene, which values "discipline", "restraint" and "seriousness". In this way, the performative behaviour of a musician is a signifier of their belonging in a specific scene.

In this way, the performative behaviour of a musician is a signifier of their belonging in a specific scene.
